title: How to Make Chicken Pastel

steps.headline: Put flour, margarine, salt and white sugar in a bowl.
Add the water while mixing with your hand.
Add the egg and milk if it is still to hard and knead again.
Sauté the onions and garlic with the chorizo de Bilbao in a frying pan.
Stir fry for a while then add the chicken stock.
Cover and cook for 10 minutes or more.
Add all the other ingredients except the evaporated milk.
Add the evaporated milk after a few minutes.
Reduce until all the flavors have merged.
Cover the baking dish/pan with the crust.
steps.description: You may cover the crust with aluminum foil but the crust will not turn golden brown.

steps.headline: Bake in a preheated oven (350°F) for 15 – 25 minutes until the crust has turned golden brown.
Serve hot as an appetizer or snack.

text: Prepare the crust Put flour, margarine, salt and white sugar in a bowl.  Add the water while mixing with your hand.  Knead the dough.  Add the egg and milk if it is still to hard and knead again.  Prepare the stuffing Sauté the onions and garlic with the chorizo de Bilbao in a frying pan.  Stir fry for a while then add the chicken stock.  Cover and cook for 10 minutes or more.  Add all the other ingredients except the evaporated milk.  Add the evaporated milk after a few minutes.  Reduce until all the flavors have merged.  Transfer to a baking dish.  Cover the baking dish/pan with the crust. You may cover the crust with aluminum foil but the crust will not turn golden brown. Bake in a preheated oven (350°F) for 15 – 25 minutes until the crust has turned golden brown.  Serve hot as an appetizer or snack.
